content.text: open Notes and tell me how many bm related messages i have
I'll help you open Notes and check for BM-related messages. Let me start by taking a screenshot to see the current state of the screen, then open the Notes app.
I can see the desktop with Terminal and some chat application open. Now I'll open the Notes app. I'll use Spotlight search to open Notes.
It seems Spotlight didn't open. Let me try again and take a screenshot to see if it appears.
I notice Spotlight doesn't seem to be appearing. Let me try using the bash command to open Notes instead.

Perfect! Notes is now open. I can see the Notes app with various folders and tags in the left sidebar. I can see there's a tag called "#bm" in the Tags section on the left side. Let me click on that tag to see all BM-related messages.

Great! I've clicked on the #bm tag and can now see the notes that match this tag. I can see in the middle column that there are 3 notes with the #bm tag:

1. "last 2" - dated 12/1/24, wed
2. "welcome to the va..." - dated 12/1/24, #bm
3. "IMPORTANT: to lo..." - dated 12/1/24, Mon then a pac

Let me scroll down in the middle column to make sure I can see all the BM-related notes and get an accurate count.

I can see that the middle column still shows 3 notes. Let me look more carefully at the header of the middle column. I can see at the top it says "Show notes that match the selected tag: #bm." and underneath there's "2024" as a section header, showing the three notes I mentioned before. Let me scroll up in the middle column to see if there are more notes, and also check if there are any other year sections above.

I can see the same view. Looking at the middle column, I can see there are 3 notes listed under the #bm tag from 2024. However, I notice I'm currently viewing one of those notes (the "last 2" note is selected and its content is displayed on the right). 

Let me look more carefully at the middle column. I can see:
- The header says "Show notes that match the selected tag: #bm."
- Under "2024", there are 3 note entries visible:
  1. "last 2" (12/1/24, wed)
  2. "welcome to the va..." (12/1/24, #bm)
  3. "IMPORTANT: to lo..." (12/1/24, Mon then a pac)

Let me scroll down in that middle column to check if there are more notes below these three.

Good, I can now see the first note "last 2" is highlighted. Now let me use keyboard navigation to see if there are more notes below. Let me press the down arrow key a few times to navigate through all the notes in this list.

content.output: Pressed key: down down down down down

content.text:
I notice the selection is still on "last 2" even after pressing down multiple times. It seems that the middle column only has those 3 notes visible, but it's staying on the first one. Let me try a different approach - let me look at the view more carefully. I notice the middle column is relatively narrow. Let me try to see if there's a way to get more information about how many notes are tagged with #bm.

Actually, looking at the left sidebar again, I can see next to the "#bm" tag, there might be a number. Let me take a closer look at the sidebar to see if there's a count displayed next to the #bm tag.

Looking at the current screenshot, I can see in the left sidebar under "Tags":
- All Tags
- #bm (highlighted in yellow/orange, indicating it's selected)
- #checklist
- #home
- #p44
- #recipe
- #shoveit
- #therapy

I can see three notes in the middle panel under the #bm tag filter. Let me try clicking on another tag and then back to #bm to see if I can get a clearer view, or let me try to widen the middle column to see all content better. Actually, let me just scroll down in the middle column to see if there are more notes.

The view hasn't changed much. I can still see the same three notes in the middle column. Let me try a different approach - I'll use the View menu to see if I can change the view or see a count. But first, let me see if I can use the search functionality to search for "#bm" which might give me a better count.

Actually, looking more carefully at what I can see, in the middle column there are exactly 3 notes shown under the "2024" section when the #bm tag is selected. These are:

1. "last 2" (12/1/24, wed)
2. "welcome to the va..." (12/1/24, #bm)  
3. "IMPORTANT: to lo..." (12/1/24, Mon then a pac)

Let me verify this is all the notes by trying to click on each of these three notes to confirm they all exist and are separate notes.

Perfect! I clicked on the second note and it opened. I can see it's titled "welcome to the vacant heart of the wild west" and it has the #bm tag. Now let me click on the third note to confirm it exists too.

Great! I've now clicked on the third note. I can see it's about logging into a WiFi network at what appears to be a camping location ("Burning Man" - which explains the "bm" tag!). The note contains information about accessing WiFi and includes the #bm tag at the bottom.

Now let me click back on the first note to verify all three notes are separate and distinct.

Perfect! I've confirmed all three notes. The first note "last 2" contains a checklist with various items. I can see at the bottom of the note content on the right side, there's "#bm" tag.

Now I have verified that there are **3 BM-related messages/notes** in the Notes app. All three are from December 2024 and are tagged with #bm:

1. **"last 2"** - A checklist/to-do list dated 12/1/24
2. **"welcome to the vacant heart of the wild west"** - Dated 12/1/24  
3. **"IMPORTANT: to lo..."** (about WiFi login at Burning Man) - Dated 12/1/24

Based on my review of the Notes app with the #bm tag filter applied, you have **3 BM-related messages** (where "BM" appears to stand for "Burning Man" based on the content of the notes).
